required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pharmacokinetic and Comparative Bioavailability Study of Testosterone Absorption After Administration of Testosterone Gel 1.62% to the Upper Arms/Shoulders Using an Application Site Rotation or a Combination of Application Sites in Hypogonadal Males
clinical_study.official_title: A Multiple Dose Pharmacokinetic and Comparative Bioavailability Study of Testosterone Absorption After Administration of 5 g Testosterone Gel 1.62% to the Upper Arms/Shoulders Using an Application Site Rotation or a Combination of Application Sites in Hypogonadal Males

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the pharmacokinetics and comparative bioavailability of Testosterone absorption in 36 Hypogonadal males after administration of 5 g Testosterone Gel 1.62% to the upper arms/shoulders using an application site rotation or a combination of application sites.

detailed_description.textblock: To evaluate the pharmacokinetics and comparative bioavailability of Testosterone absorption in 36 Hypogonadal males after administration of 5 g Testosterone Gel 1.62% to the upper arms/shoulders using an application site rotation or a combination of application sites.

primary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic Parameters Total Testosterone, dihydrotestosterone, estradiol AUC, Cav, Cmax, Tmax

secondary_outcome.measure: Application site evaluation based on the clinical evaluation of skin reactions grading scale

intervention.description: 5 grams administered using an application Site Rotation
5 grams administered using an a combination of Application sites

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria
1. Hypogonadal males
2. Screening testosterone <300 ng/dL
Exclusion Criteria
1. Smokers
2. Previous history of or current or suspected prostate or breast cancer
